title: 6.1.3 Create health check endpoint
body:
## Parent Issue
#23 - 6.1 Container Packaging

## Objective
Create health check endpoint that validates all container components.

## Requirements
- GET /health endpoint
- Check database connectivity
- Check IB Platform status
- Check Redis (if enabled)
- Return structured JSON response

## Implementation

```python
# src/cloud_optimizer/api/routers/health.py
from fastapi import APIRouter, Depends
from sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import AsyncSession
from datetime import datetime

router = APIRouter()

@router.get("/health")
async def health_check(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)):
    components = {
        "database": await check_database(db),
        "ib_platform": await check_ib_platform(),
        "redis": await check_redis() if settings.REDIS_URL else "disabled",
    }
    
    all_ok = all(v == "ok" for v in components.values() if v != "disabled")
    status = "healthy" if all_ok else "unhealthy"
    
    return {
        "status": status,
        "version": settings.VERSION,
        "components": components,
        "timestamp": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),
    }

async def check_database(db: AsyncSession) -> str:
    try:
        await db.execute(text("SELECT 1"))
        return "ok"
    except Exception as e:
        return f"error: {str(e)}"
```

## Files to Create
- `src/cloud_optimizer/api/routers/health.py`
- `tests/api/test_health.py`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] /health returns 200 when all components healthy
- [ ] /health returns 503 when any component unhealthy
- [ ] Response includes version and timestamp
- [ ] Database check works
- [ ] Tests pass

## Estimated Time
1.5 hours
